hive_lesson.title: 1222 Shipwrecks
hive_lesson.description: Peter talks with Jana about shipwrecks.

hive_text_custom.text: So, Peter, I've been asking you about hunting for treasure. Can I ask you a few more questions?
So why are there so many sunken ships in South Africa?

of Africa because of the really bad weather. It really changes really quickly in those parts and with the ancient ships I guess they weren't really prepared for that kind of weather, it's unexpected, so I think that's probably one reason. And I think one of the other reasons is probably
, people that were after them, the
I guess if you want to put it that way, yeah.
Right, and if it's so dangerous, how do people find these sunken ships nowadays?
I think, obviously with technological advances it's easier to
where the, possibly where these sunken ships might be. I think they can use
and things like that but obviously also finding out more about history and, you know, going through historical records and finding out the old
and possibly where ships got lost and finding it that way, I think, is now, is more easier than it used to be.
So it sounds like an interesting combination of technology, science, history...
So your friend does this as a hobby. Do you know if it's very expensive? Is it a big investment to...?

As far as I remember what he told me and I think it's really expensive and they formed a little company to start off with but because it involves so much searching and basically doing historical research, also doing a lot of preparation and technological preparation and finding, first tracking, sorry first finding places where possible finds may be and then actually preparing equipment and some of it's really deep sea diving so it involves, I think, a lot of

to get it going. Obviously there might be a lot of return when they actually find something but I think in many cases they don't find as much as they expected so there's a potential for losing a lot of money so you'd have to have quite a bit of capital investment behind you if you start out.
Right. So you need a lot of courage and a lot of money?
Yes. But I think he's an adventurer so he, I think he goes where adventure leads him so it would be a nice job to do I think.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 3) How do they find sunken ships?
4) Treasure diving is a combination of ____.
5) You need a lot of ____ to start a diving company.

hive_text_custom.text: I guess there are many ships around the southern tip of            Africa, because there is really bad weather.
The 'southern tip' of a country is the point that is the            furthest to the south. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
The southern tip of the country is known for hot              weather.
 There is a huge storm moving across the northern tip of              the state tomorrow.

hive_text_custom.text: Another reason for sunken ships is piracy.
'Piracy' is what pirates do. It is robbery or illegal            violence on the sea. We also 'piracy' to refer to illegal            copies of merchandise. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Because of piracy you never know if you are getting a              genuine product.
 Piracy is a big problem for the music and film              industries.

hive_text_custom.text: Pirates were after the loot on the ships.
If you are 'after something,' you are pursuing something            that you want. 'Loot' is possessions that are taken in a            forceful or dishonest way. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
The robbers escaped with a lot of loot.
 Their team is really after first place in this              competition.

hive_text_custom.text: Obviously, with technological advances, it's easier to            track where the ships might be.
When you 'track' something, you follow it or look for it            using some strategic method. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: Would you like to be able to track the package you are              sending until it arrives?Hunters have to track animals though the woods.

hive_text_custom.text: I think they can use satellite navigation and things like            that.
'Satellite navigation' is a system used for directing            yourself to a specific place. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
It is much easier to find your way around cities that              you are not familiar with now that there is satellite              navigation.
 Bad weather can cause problems with the satellite              navigation.

hive_text_custom.text: The go through old shipping routes to find out where ships            possibly got lost.
A 'shipping route' is the path that cargo ships take to            get from one place to another. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: The building of the Panama Canal decreased the distance              for many shipping routes. This particular shipping route takes about 3 weeks.

hive_text_custom.text: I think it involves a lot of initial capital investment.
'Initial capital investment' is the money you have to pay            to start a company or organization.  Notice the            following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Starting a printing and copying company would require a              lot of initial capital investment.
 People like internet companies because the initial              capital investment is less than a real business.

doesn't work well here, because the signal is not very strong.
Many artificial canals were built to decrease the distance of shipping
The hardest part to starting your own business is the initial capital
